thread.title: Valley Springs sweeps Norfork at Classic
thread.title_full: Valley Springs sweeps Norfork at Classic

title: Valley Springs sweeps Norfork at Classic
text:
Valley Springs sweeps Norfork at Classic NEAL DENTON, ndenton@baxterbulletin.com 11:14 p.m. CDT October 20, 2015 Buy Photo Norfork's Wyatt Chapman goes up for two while defended by Valley Springs' Logan Henson during the Tigers' 69-65 victory over the Panthers on Tuesday night. (Photo: Neal Denton/The Baxter Bulletin) Buy Photo 10 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
NORFORK — The Valley Springs Tigers used a strong run to end the third quarter, surging to a 17-point lead, but the Tigers were forced to fend off a furious Norfork Panther rally to hold on for a 69-65 victory in Twin Rivers Classic action Tuesday night at Bobby D. Hulse Gymnasium. 
The Tigers went just 2 of 11 from the foul line in the fourth quarter, but the two they made came from junior Logan Henson, who knocked down a pair with just :09.1 left on the clock to send the lead to 69-65. 
Travis Lewis had brought the Panthers within 34-33 early in the third on a 3-pointer from the corner, but the Tigers answered with a 13-3 run to stretch their lead to double digits for the first time. 
Valley Springs ended up outscoring Norfork 24-8 to end the third quarter after the Panthers had climbed to within one. The Tigers held a 58-41 advantage going into the final frame. 
Grant Casey knocked down a 3-pointer to bring the Panthers within 64-53 with 4:35 left, and Norfork kept inching closer. Jacob Standfield and Casey each scored to bring the hosts within 64-57 with 2:56 remaining. 
After Valley Springs missed a pair of free throws, Lewis — who led Norfork with 16 points — scored to bring the Panthers within five. Valley Springs guard Dalton Hogue was whistled for a charge and fouled out on the ensuing play, and Wyatt Chapman hit 1 of 2 foul shots for the Panthers to climb within 64-60. 
Valley Springs freshman Dalton Audeoud knocked down a big trey — his second of the game — to make it 67-60 with 1:40 remaining, but Chapman hit a pair of free throws, and the Tigers missed two more foul shots. 
Lewis hit 1 of 2 at the line with :27.8 left to play, and the Panthers scored on a tip-in with :13.3 left to draw within 67-65. Henson was fouled with :09.1 left and atoned for two missed charity tosses earlier in the quarter. 
Jake Wynn led all scorers with 17 points for Valley Springs but did not score in the fourth quarter. Drew Saunders added 11 and Hogue notched 10 for the Tigers. 
Casey tallied 15 points, Jacob Standfield scored 14 and Chapman added 13 for the Panthers, who fall to 1-1 on the season. 
With Norfork up 8-6 early, the Tigers scored 10 straight points to take a 16-8 advantage. Norfork rallied back within 16-14 after a 3-pointer by Casey, a bucket from Chapman and 1-of-2 free-throw shooting by Mason Rosson. The Panthers trailed just 18-14 at the end of one period. 
Lewis buried a 3-pointer to being the second quarter, and after Valley Springs scored a basket, Creed Chapman hit a trey to knot the score at 20-20 with 5:55 left in the half. 
The Tigers responded with a 9-1 run, receiving five from Wynn, and pushing to a 29-21 lead. Norfork crawled to within 31-26 by the end of the half. 
VALLEY SPRINGS (2-0) 
Wynn 17, Saunders 11, Hogue 10, Garvin 8, Audeoud 8, King 6, Henson 4, Drewry 2. 
NORFORK (1-1) 
Lewis 16, Casey 15, Standfield 14, W. Chapman 13, C. Chapman 3, Reynolds 3, Rosson 1. 
VALLEY 18 13 27 11 - 69 
NORFORK 14 12 15 24 - 65 
Senior girls 
Valley Springs 63, 
Norfork 33 
Lady Tiger guards Payton Tennison and Ashlynn Taylor were hot from behind the three-point stripe, hitting nine total treys in an easy victory. 
Tennison hit three 3-pointers in the first quarter as the Lady Tigers scored the first 11 of the game and held a 21-7 lead at the end of one. 
Taylor got going in the second quarter, draining three 3-pointers as the Lady Tigers stretched their lead to 42-17 by halftime. 
Taylor and Tennison combined for three straight treys to begin the second half as Valley Springs stretched its lead to 51-17. Buy Photo 
Norfork's Marleigh Dodson dribbles between Valley Springs' Callie Ray, left, and Payton Tennison during the Lady Panthers' 63-33 loss to the Lady Tigers on Tuesday night. (Photo: Neal Denton/The Baxter Bulletin) 
Makayla Irby led Norfork with eight points, and Marleigh Dodson added seven without making a field goal. The Lady Panthers made just nine field goals in the game, with Matty Dillard and Irby each hitting a pair of 3s and Riley Scalf adding one trey. 
In the first two games of the night, the Bay Lady Yellowjackets defeated Jasper 49-46 on a 3-point, buzzer-beater by Katie Ferguson, and the Yellowjackets defeated Jasper 69-51 with the help of a 19-5 first-half run. 
VALLEY SPRINGS (2-0) 
Taylor 18, Tennison 16, Williams 13, Ray 5, Patrick 5, Richardson 4, Lippe 2. 
NORFORK (0-1) 
Irby 8, Dodson 7, Dillard 6, Greve 5, Scalf 5, Belding 1, Staples 1. 
VALLEY 21 21 17 4 - 63 
NORFORK 7 10 5 11 - 33
